ui

Class RenderingWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • ui.RenderingWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class RenderingWindow
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Class used for rendering the game isometrically.
    Author:
    Jake Dorne
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Rotates tile arrays depending on the current viewing direction and then calls the isometric renderer on the resulting arrays. Then renders the lighting if the location requires it to.
        Overrides:
        paint in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • lighting

        private void lighting(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d,
                      java.awt.Point[] playerPoints)
        Creates a black square to cover map in darkness and then erases and draws an oval over player using gradient effect to reveal area around them
        Parameters:
        g2d - - Graphics object
        playerPoints - - List of points of all players to be used in lighting

      • isometric

        public void isometric(Tile[][] tiles,
                      Tile[][] rooms,
                      java.awt.Graphics offgc)
        Iterates through arrays of tiles drawing the map terrain, then iterates through room tiles to draw buildings depending on the arrangement of tiles. new x position = x/2 + y/2 ( + or - constants to fit properly such as imageHeight) new y position = y/4 - x/4 ( + or - constants to fit properly such as imageHeight)
        Parameters:
        tiles - - 2D array of terrain to be drawn
        rooms - - 2D array of rooms to be drawn
        offgc - - the graphics

      • addToDirInt

        private int addToDirInt(int directionInt,
                        int toAdd)
        Changes walkdirection for drawing depending on camera angle
        Parameters:
        directionInt - - current direction of player
        toAdd - - amount to add to it (depends on camera angle)
        Returns:
        directionInt - directionInt after adding. Wraps around if it goes over 3

      • getPlayerImage

        private java.awt.Image getPlayerImage(Player p)
        If the player is not attacking, it finds the correct frame in the walk cycle as well as the animation direction. If the player is attacking, it finds the correct frame and animation in one of the attacking animation cycles.
        Parameters:
        p - - The player to get image for
        Returns:
        image - The image to return

      • getRealPlayerCoords

        private int[] getRealPlayerCoords(Player p,
                                  Tile[][] tiles)
        If the player's position is (0,0) when the map is rotated, the position of the player will still remain 0,0. This method gets the coordinates the player is at in the rotated version of the array. If the map is rotated to the east, this method would return (map.length, 0) despite the player position still being (0,0).
        Parameters:
        tiles -
        Returns:
        int of player x and y

      • rotateCounterClockwise

        public Tile[][] rotateCounterClockwise(Tile[][] tiles)
        Rotates given array of tiles 90 degrees counter-clockwise.
        Parameters:
        tiles - - array to be rotated
        Returns:
        rotated array

      • rotateClockwise

        public Tile[][] rotateClockwise(Tile[][] tiles)
        Rotates given array of tiles 90 degrees clockwise.
        Parameters:
        tiles - - array to be rotated
        Returns:
        rotated array

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(Game.Direction d)
        Sets direction of renderer. May possibly end up being stored in another class?
        Parameters:
        d - - new direction

      • getDirection

        public Game.Direction getDirection()
        Returns:
        current direction of renderer/camera

      • updateCamera

        public void updateCamera(int[] realCoord)
        changes the camera coords to the fit player in middle of screen camera x = player rendering x position - (renderwindow size / 2) camera y = player rendering y position - tilesize/2
        Parameters:
        realCoord - - int array of player x and y in the tile array
